content:
This looks like a **drop shipping scam** or at best a **low-quality influencer marketing scheme** where they make money off the shipping fees while sending you cheap or non-existent products.  

Here’s why this is a **red flag:**  

🚨 **They’re asking you to pay for shipping** – Legitimate brand ambassador programs don’t make you pay for anything upfront.  
🚨 **No real brand presence** – The company doesn’t seem reputable or well-known.  
🚨 **Suspicious referral structure** – They want you to recruit others with a referral code, which often means a **pyramid-style commission scheme**.  
🚨 **No contract, just a DM pitch** – Real ambassador programs have agreements/contracts, not random messages asking you to buy something first.  

### **🔥 What You Should Do Instead:**  
✅ **Ignore & don’t engage.** These programs prey on small influencers.  
✅ **If interested in brand deals, target real pet brands.**  
✅ **Consider reaching out to known brands yourself** (BarkBox, The Dodo, Chewy.com, etc.).  
✅ **Build organic reach first** before worrying about sponsorships.  

🚀 **If Chewy gains traction, legit brands will come to you.** Focus on content & growth first, and avoid wasting time on these kinds of offers.
